Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of the Favolaschia calocera complex
with descriptions of five new species
Keywords:
multi-gene phylogeny, Mycenaceae, species complex,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Favolaschia calocera was originally described in
Madagascar, and it was reported to be worldwide distributed. In the
current study, samples of the Favolaschia calocera from America,
Australia, China, Kenya, Italy, New Zealand and Thailand are analyzed.
Our study proves that Favolaschia calocera is a species complex, and six
species are recognized in the complex including five new species. One
new species is discovered from Australia, namely Favolaschia claudopus,
four new species are found from China, namely F. brevibasidiata, F.
brevistipitata, F. longistipitata and F. minutissima. Phylogenetically,
these five new species form five independent lineages based on ITS
dataset and ITS + nLSU + mt-SSU + nu-SSU + TEF1 dataset. Illustrated
descriptions of these five new species are given. An identification key
and a comparison of the characteristics to spe-cies of the Favolaschia
calocera complex are provided.
